message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CC, cs.DL 

This paper is about automatic summarization of scientific documents, which involves natural language processing and information retrieval techniques. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with the intersection of computer science and linguistics. 

The paper also uses statistical methods for sentence scoring, which falls under the sub-category cs.IR (Information Retrieval). 

Additionally, the paper involves machine learning techniques for document pre-processing and sentence scoring, which could fall under the sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

The paper also involves some computational complexity analysis, which could fall under the sub-category cs.CC (Computational Complexity). 

Finally, the paper deals with a specific domain of knowledge (Organic Chemistry), which could fall under the sub-category cs.DL (Digital Libraries).
